revised_title: The Skull of Holocephali: Morphology and Phylogenetic Relationships
tldr: The authors studied the skull morphology of Holocephali, a group of primitive living fishes, and compared it with the skulls of other fish groups. They found that Holocephali have a unique attachment of the pterygo-quadrate to the braincase and a complete otic process. Their research suggests that Holocephali represent the most primitive living Gnathostomes known and have important implications for understanding the evolution of fish skulls.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate morphology
